intro: Lagenophora gunniana, commonly known as the Gunn's lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
